name: Millenium Park Abuja
description: Zuma Rock is a giant monolith and one of Nigeria’s most iconic landmarks. It is often referred to as the 'Gateway to Abuja' and is a popular spot for sightseeing and photography.

name: Erin Ijesha Waterfall
description: Also known as Olumirin Waterfalls, this natural wonder is a beautiful series of cascading falls surrounded by lush greenery, ideal for hiking and nature exploration.

name: Lekki Beach Lagos
description: A popular eco-tourism destination featuring Nigeria’s longest canopy walkway, nature trails, and wildlife like monkeys and peacocks in a serene forest reserve.

name: Obudu Mountain Resort
description: This resort is located on a picturesque plateau and offers a temperate climate, cable car rides, hiking trails, and breathtaking views of the surrounding mountains.

name: Nike Art Gallery
description: One of the largest art galleries in West Africa, showcasing Nigerian contemporary and traditional artworks, textiles, sculptures, and more.

name: Yankari National Park
description: A premier wildlife destination in Nigeria, home to elephants, lions, and baboons, along with natural warm springs ideal for swimming and relaxation.

name: Ogbunike Caves
description: An ancient and sacred site made up of interconnected caves, waterfalls, and streams, with a long history tied to local spiritual beliefs.

name: Aso Rock
description: A prominent rock formation in Nigeria’s capital, located near the Presidential Villa, offering great views and a chance to learn about Nigerian governance and history.
